revised_title: Experimental Investigation of Thermo-Dynamical Properties of Superheated Steam
tldr: The authors investigate the flow of superheated steam through an orifice and find that the maximum flow occurs when the pressure ratio is far below the theoretical value, indicating a different law of flow than the adiabatic. They also determine the specific heat at constant pressure and the cooling effect of the steam, finding that the specific heat is nearly independent of pressure and the cooling effect is inversely proportional to the absolute temperature.
